dct:title: Miami-Dade Home Owner's Loan Corporation (HOLC) Neighborhood Redlining Grade
dct:creator: University of Richmond's Digital Scholarship Lab;;;;https://ror.org/03y71xh61;ROR;https://ror.org/
dct:publisher: University of Richmond's Digital Scholarship Lab
dct:rights:
Use items owned by Esri in ArcGIS Online in conjunction with Esri software or an ArcGIS or Developer subscription for
projects and applications that are both internal and external use

Use the basemap data offline in the following manner
• The data may only be taken offline using Esri Content Packages
• The package can be used with any device as long as it is used exclusively with Esri software
dct:description: The historical redlining grade from 143 cities across the United States. This dataset is the subset for Miami-Dade County in Florida.
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/mdc_holc_redlining/{download,etl} && cd /data/mdc_holc_redlining

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  ogr2ogr -nln mdc_holc_redlining download/mdc_holc_redlining.geojson "https://services.arcgis.com/jIL9msH9OI208GCb/ArcGIS/rest/services/HOLC_Neighborhood_Redlining/FeatureServer/0/query?where=city=%27Miami%27&outFields=*&outSR=4326&f=json"

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/mdc_holc_redlining.geojson

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/mdc_holc_redlining.geojson -nlt multipolygon -nln mdc_holc_redlining

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE mdc_holc_redlining
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'mdc_holc_redlining',
  'geom_local',2236,'multipolygon',2
);
UPDATE mdc_holc_redlining
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(ST_Multi(geom),2236)));
CREATE INDEX mdc_holc_redlining_geom_local_idx
  ON mdc_holc_redlining
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"cd /data/mdc_holc_redlining/
mkdir -p derived
# Create pg_dump and downloadable zip of table in derivate directory 
pg_dump -d $POSTGRES_DB -U $POSTGRES_USER -p $POSTGRES_PORT -h postgis-e43b1q10x1kr5qh0 -t mdc_holc_redlining > derived/mdc_holc_redlining.sql
tar -czf derived/mdc_holc_redlining.sql.tar.gz meta_dcat_mdc_holc_redlining.json -C derived mdc_holc_redlining.sql
dcat:contactPoint: University of Miami Libraries, Frost Institute for Data Science and Computing
